lines:
1981

June 8, 1926

Nr. S. S. Kman 
11 Tue au rectal Foch 
Tientsin, China

My dear Kuan:

Meny, many thanks for your friendly fit, which reached me 
a day or to ago and which I shall always value for itself, but more for the 
thought and good will behind it. Do tall me, though, the real meaning and 
significance of the long stroll, which ie a bit different from anything I 
have encountered before. . I called in you Sun for help tout found in as 
yugaled as I Won't you enlighten me?

the 
It men fine to hear from you, anyway, and through pennies of 
this gift to feel the old friendly contact once more and to Isnor that you 
fro alive and well and still mineral of our la Prionde on this side of 
the globe. Do vote me and tell me how 1.17e in using you and something 
about an architect's work and protests in China.

By the way, one of my very good friends and a member of our 
Andover Frusteos, Hr. Henry I. Stinson of Them Tork, 1s 11%ely to visit China 
in the near future. If he does, I am going to give him a letter of into -
suction to you, for I know you will be led to meet him and I minor you can 
and will offer him and He good wife friendly help and advice. Ir. Stinson

was projecting attorney of her york under Roosevelt, with whom he was on very 
intimate terms, and Secretary of War under President Taft. He is a fellow of 
exceptionally high ideal and fine character and of the kind we like to have 
foreighnnssjudge us by. You 111 thoroughly enjoy meeting him, I am sure, if 
the chance offers, and I shall appreciate any friendly assistance you may be

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter to Sung Sing Kwan to Alfred E. Stearns about the significance of the long form scroll given by Kwan to Stearns. Offer to introduce Henry Stimson to Kwan if Stimson travels to China (Page 1).
metadata.note_acquisition: Phillips Academy Archives and Special Collections received the letters and materials of Sung Sing Kwan from Alfred E. Stearns in ____(date)
metadata.note_preferred-citation: From The Trustees of Phillips Academy.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
